alert.note: Alert for Cascades in Lane County; Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 4:11AM PST until January 08 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 3000 feet, snow expected with total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 2000 feet, heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 feet, except 6 to 12 inches between 2000 to 3000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph, except up to 85 mph above 5000 feet. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades and Cascades in Lane County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 4 PM PST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very dangerous. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down trees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are possible Tuesday morning through Tuesday night, especially above 4000-5000 feet.
info.instruction: Anyone with travel plans or recreation plans in the Cascades on Tuesday and/or Wednesday should reconsider their plans. At the very least, those who must travel will need to be well prepared with chains, a winter survival kit, and a reliable source of communication. It would also be wise to alert friends and family before traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Cascades in Lane County; Northern Oregon Cascades
